name: Hard Warioland 4 Quiz / Test | Video Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the bird required to open the door to more levels?
questions.explanation:
Keybert.

	I don't think the little white blob bears any resemblance to a bird, but it is a necessary part of the game. In every level one must collect four diamond pieces as well as Keybert, the key/bird hybrid.

questions.text: What does Wario jump on to start the countdown for each level?
questions.explanation:
The Hurry-Up Frog.

	The Hurry-Up Frog starts a countdown whose length varies according to the level and the difficulty of the game. If the timer runs out, Wario will begin to lose his coins. Once he has no more coins left, he must start the level over again.

questions.text: Who is the princess that Wario must save?
questions.explanation:
Princess Shokora.

	Shokora helps Wario throughout the levels by selling him items he can use to defeat the bosses at the end of each passage. She also appears as the black cat that leads Wario to the abscess within the pyramid.

The Golden Diva.

	The Golden Diva is about as obsessed with money as Wario is! Wario must defeat the Golden Diva to break the curse on Princess Shokora.

questions.text: Wario gets a kiss from the Princess for saving her.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Just imagine a meany like Wario getting kissed! He probably thinks that girls have cooties anyway.

questions.text: Which of these is not a transformation in the game?
questions.explanation:
Arty Wario.

	Arty Wario is from the Nintendo DS game: "Wario: Master of Disguise". Snowball Wario rolls down hills and breaks blocks, Fat Wario breaks blue blocks, and Zombie Wario can float through certain kinds of floors.

questions.text: Where does Wario hear about the ancient pyramid in which the game takes place?
questions.explanation:
The newspaper.

	While sitting at home, Wario passes the time by reading the newspaper. Reading about a recently-discovered pyramid, Wario hops in his Wario Car and drives off to investigate.

questions.text: What is the name of the first boss Wario must defeat?
questions.explanation:
Spoiled Rotten.

	Spoiled Rotten has ten health points and is a relatively easy boss. Wario can buy certain items to help him during battle.

questions.text: Which of these objects cannot be used to break rocks?
questions.explanation:
Boxing glove.

	Wario can throw old men through narrow passages to break blocks; this fits in with Wario's mean and rotten nature. Old men are only found in bonus stages, which can be reached via pipes.

questions.text: Which one of these options is NOT a passage available in the game?
questions.explanation:
Pearl Passage.

	After defeating the first boss, Wario goes through four passages: Ruby, Topaz, Emerald, and Sapphire. There is no Pearl Passage in "Warioland 4".
